moves.1. e4: This is my first annotated game, so feel free to comment and fix it.
moves.1... e5 2. Nc3 Nf6 3. Bc4 Bc5: 3. Nxe4 seems to be better there (like 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Nc3 Bc5 4. Nxe5, but by black)
moves.4. d3 d6 5. f4: Too ambitious, after 5. ... Ng4! 6. Nh3 Qh4+! there's no 7. g3 because of Qxh3, and Ke2/Kf1 is bad too due to of 7. ... Nf2 (8. Nxf2 Qxf2#), and the White King is in trouble.
moves.5... Nc6 6. Nf3 Bg4 7. Bb5 Qd7: what Black pin their Knight again for? why not simply O-O?
moves.8. Nd5: 8. fxe5 wins a pawn, after 8. ... dxe5 9. Nxe5 Bxd1 10. Nxd7 Kxd7 11. Kxd1.
moves.8... Nd4: Ha-ha. Simply gives up a Queen. The game is about to be finished now.
moves.9. Bxd7+ Kxd7 10. Ne3 h5 11. O-O: There were no reasons to castle and put White's King under the pin from c5.
moves.11... exf4 12. Nxg4:
White have got a material advantage, but this move could get them in serious trouble:
12. ... Ne2++ 13. Kh1 Ng3+ 14. hxg3 hxg4+ 15. Nh4 fxg3 16. d4 Rxh4+ 17. Kg1 Rah8 and there's no defence against 18. ... Rh1#!
moves.12... hxg4 13. Nxd4 Bxd4+ 14. Rf2:
Suddenly, this is the only one best move, because of this variation:
14. Kh1 Rxh2+! 15. Kxh2 Rh8#
moves.14... Bxf2+ 15. Kxf2 Rxh2 16. Bxf4 Rh5 1: An attempt to attack or what?..
moves.18. Qb3: Double strike to b7 and f7
There's nothing to comment anymore, White's victory is easy as shit. Black resigned.
